00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 PGstringevaluators.pl - Macros that generate string answer evaluators.
00020 
00021 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00022 
00023     ANS(str_cmp("increasing"));
00024     
00025     ANS(unordered_str_cmp("A C E"));
00026 
00027 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00028 
00029 String answer evaluators compare a student string to the correct string.
00030 
00031 =head2 MathObjects and answer evaluators
00032 
00033 The MathObjects system provides a String->cmp() method that produce answer
00034 evaluators for string comparisons. It is recommended that you use the String
00035 object's cmp() method directly if possible.
00036 
00037 =cut
00038 
00039 BEGIN { be_strict() }
00040 sub _PGstringevaluators_init {}
00041 
00042 =head1 String Filters
00043 
00044 Different filters can be applied to allow various degrees of variation. Both the
00045 student and correct answers are subject to the same filters, to ensure that
00046 there are no unexpected matches or rejections.
00047 
00048 =cut
00049 
00050 ################################
00051 ## STRING ANSWER FILTERS
00052 
00053 ## IN:  --the string to be filtered
00054 ##      --a list of the filters to use
00055 ##
00056 ## OUT: --the modified string
00057 ##
00058 ## Use this subroutine instead of the
00059 ## individual filters below it
00060 
00061 sub str_filters {
00062     my $stringToFilter = shift @_;
00063     # filters now take an answer hash, so encapsulate the string 
00064     # in the answer hash.
00065     my $rh_ans = new AnswerHash;
00066     $rh_ans->{student_ans} = $stringToFilter;
00067     $rh_ans->{correct_ans}='';
00068     my @filters_to_use = @_;
00069     my %known_filters = (   
00070                 'remove_whitespace'     =>  \&remove_whitespace,
00071                 'compress_whitespace'   =>  \&compress_whitespace,
00072                 'trim_whitespace'       =>  \&trim_whitespace,
00073                 'ignore_case'           =>  \&ignore_case,
00074                 'ignore_order'          =>  \&ignore_order,
00075     );
00076 
00077     #test for unknown filters
00078     foreach my $filter ( @filters_to_use ) {
00079         #check that filter is known
00080         die "Unknown string filter $filter (try checking the parameters to str_cmp() )"
00081                                 unless exists $known_filters{$filter};
00082         $rh_ans = $known_filters{$filter}($rh_ans);  # apply filter.
00083     }
00084 
00085     return $rh_ans->{student_ans};
00086 }
00087 
00088 =over
00089 
00090 =item remove_whitespace
00091 
00092 Removes all whitespace from the string. It applies the following substitution to
00093 the string:
00094 
00095     $filteredAnswer =~ s/\s+//g;
00096 
00097 =cut
00098 
00099 sub remove_whitespace {
00100     my $rh_ans = shift;
00101     die "expected an answer hash" unless ref($rh_ans)=~/HASH/i;
00102     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'remove_whitespace'; 
00103     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ s/\s+//g;     # remove all whitespace
00104     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ s/\s+//g;     # remove all whitespace
00105     return $rh_ans;
00106 }
00107 
00108 =item compress_whitespace
00109 
00110 Removes leading and trailing whitespace, and replaces all other blocks of
00111 whitespace by a single space. Applies the following substitutions:
00112 
00113     $filteredAnswer =~ s/^\s*//;
00114     $filteredAnswer =~ s/\s*$//;
00115     $filteredAnswer =~ s/\s+/ /g;
00116 
00117 =cut
00118 
00119 sub compress_whitespace {
00120     my $rh_ans = shift;
00121     die "expected an answer hash" unless ref($rh_ans)=~/HASH/i;
00122     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'compress_whitespace';
00123     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ s/^\s*//;     # remove initial whitespace
00124     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ s/\s*$//;     # remove trailing whitespace
00125     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ s/\s+/ /g;        # replace spaces by single space
00126     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ s/^\s*//;     # remove initial whitespace
00127     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ s/\s*$//;     # remove trailing whitespace
00128     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ s/\s+/ /g;        # replace spaces by single space
00129 
00130     return $rh_ans;
00131 }
00132 
00133 =item trim_whitespace
00134 
00135 Removes leading and trailing whitespace. Applies the following substitutions:
00136 
00137     $filteredAnswer =~ s/^\s*//;
00138     $filteredAnswer =~ s/\s*$//;
00139 
00140 =cut
00141 
00142 sub trim_whitespace {
00143     my $rh_ans = shift;
00144     die "expected an answer hash" unless ref($rh_ans)=~/HASH/i;
00145     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'trim_whitespace';
00146     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ s/^\s*//;     # remove initial whitespace
00147     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ s/\s*$//;     # remove trailing whitespace
00148     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ s/^\s*//;     # remove initial whitespace
00149     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ s/\s*$//;     # remove trailing whitespace
00150 
00151     return $rh_ans;
00152 }
00153 
00154 =item ignore_case
00155 
00156 Ignores the case of the string. More accurately, it converts the string to
00157 uppercase (by convention). Applies the following function:
00158 
00159     $filteredAnswer = uc($filteredAnswer);
00160 
00161 =cut
00162 
00163 sub ignore_case {
00164     my $rh_ans = shift;
00165     die "expected an answer hash" unless ref($rh_ans)=~/HASH/i;
00166     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'ignore_case';
00167     $rh_ans->{student_ans} =~ tr/a-z/A-Z/;
00168     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} =~ tr/a-z/A-Z/;
00169     return $rh_ans;
00170 }
00171 
00172 =item ignore_order
00173 
00174 Ignores the order of the letters in the string. This is used for problems of the
00175 form "Choose all that apply." Specifically, it removes all whitespace and
00176 lexically sorts the letters in ascending alphabetical order. Applies the
00177 following functions:
00178 
00179     $filteredAnswer = join("", lex_sort(split(/\s*/, $filteredAnswer)));
00180 
00181 =cut
00182 
00183 sub ignore_order {
00184     my $rh_ans = shift;
00185     die "expected an answer hash" unless ref($rh_ans)=~/HASH/i;
00186     $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = 'ignore_order';
00187     $rh_ans->{student_ans} = join( "", lex_sort( split( /\s*/, $rh_ans->{student_ans} ) ) );
00188     $rh_ans->{correct_ans} = join( "", lex_sort( split( /\s*/, $rh_ans->{correct_ans} ) ) );
00189     
00190     return $rh_ans;
00191 }
00192 
00193 =back
00194 
00195 =head1 str_cmp
00196 
00197     ANS(str_cmp($answer_or_answer_array_ref, @filters));
00198     ANS(str_cmp($answer_or_answer_array_ref, %options));
00199 
00200 Compares a string or a list of strings, using a named hash of options to set
00201 parameters. This can make for more readable code than using the "mode"_str_cmp()
00202 style, but some people find one or the other easier to remember.
00203 
00204 $answer_or_answer_array_ref can be a scalar representing the correct answer or a
00205 reference to an array of string scalars. If multiple answers are given, str_cmp
00206 returns one answer evaluator for each answer.
00207 
00208 num_cmp() differentiates %options from @filters by checking for the names of
00209 supported options in the list. Currently "filter", "filters", and "debug" are
00210 checked for. If these strings are found in the argument list, it is assumed that
00211 %options is present rather than @filters.
00212 
00213 %options can contain the following items:
00214 
00215 =over
00216 
00217 =item filters
00218 
00219 A reference to an array of filter names, to be applied to both the correct
00220 answer and the student's answer before doing string comparison. Supported
00221 filters are listed above. filter is avaliable as a synonym for filters.
00222 
00223 =item debug
00224 
00225 If set to 1, extra debugging information will be output.
00226 
00227 =back
00228 
00229 If %options is not detected, the rest of the argument list is assumed to be a
00230 list of filter names. Hence, the following two forms are equivalent:
00231 
00232     ANS(str_cmp($ans, 'remove_whitespace', 'ignore_order'));
00233     ANS(str_cmp($ans, filters=>['remove_whitespace', 'ignore_order']));
00234 
00235 =head2 Examples
00236 
00237     # same as std_str_cmp() -- matches "Hello", "  hello", etc.
00238     str_cmp("Hello")
00239 
00240     # same as std_str_cmp_list()
00241     str_cmp(["Hello", "Goodbye"]);
00242 
00243     # matches "hello", " hello  ", etc.
00244     str_cmp(' hello ', 'trim_whitespace');
00245 
00246     # matches "ACB" and "A B C", but not "abc"
00247     str_cmp('ABC', filters=>'ignore_order');
00248 
00249     # matches "def" and "d e f" but not "fed"
00250     str_cmp('D E F', 'remove_whitespace', 'ignore_case');
00251 
00252 =cut
00253 
00254 sub str_cmp {
00255     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00256     $correctAnswer = '' unless defined($correctAnswer);
00257     my @options = @_;
00258     my %options = ();
00259     # backward compatibility
00260     if (grep /filters|debug|filter/, @options) { # see whether we have hash keys in the input.
00261         %options = @options;
00262     } elsif (@options) {     # all options are names of filters.
00263         $options{filters} = [@options];
00264     }
00265     my $ra_filters;
00266     assign_option_aliases( \%options,
00267                 'filter'               =>  'filters',
00268      );
00269     set_default_options(    \%options,
00270                 'filters'               =>  [qw(trim_whitespace compress_whitespace ignore_case)],
00271                 'debug'                 =>  0,
00272                 'type'                  =>  'str_cmp',
00273     );
00274     $options{filters} = (ref($options{filters}))?$options{filters}:[$options{filters}]; 
00275     # make sure this is a reference to an array.
00276     # error-checking for filters occurs in the filters() subroutine
00277 #   if( not defined( $options[0] ) ) {      # used with no filters as alias for std_str_cmp()
00278 #       @options = ( 'compress_whitespace', 'ignore_case' );
00279 #   }
00280 # 
00281 #   if( $options[0] eq 'filters' ) {        # using filters => [f1, f2, ...] notation
00282 #       $ra_filters = $options[1];
00283 #   }
00284 #   else {                      # using a list of filters
00285 #       $ra_filters = \@options;
00286 #   }
00287 
00288     # thread over lists
00289     my @ans_list = ();
00290 
00291     if ( ref($correctAnswer) eq 'ARRAY' ) {
00292         @ans_list = @{$correctAnswer};
00293     }
00294     else {
00295         push( @ans_list, $correctAnswer );
00296     }
00297 
00298     # final_answer;
00299     my @output_list = ();
00300 
00301     foreach my $ans (@ans_list) {
00302         push(@output_list, STR_CMP( 
00303                         'correct_ans'   =>  $ans,
00304                         'filters'       =>  $options{filters},
00305                         'type'          =>  $options{type},
00306                         'debug'         =>  $options{debug},
00307              )
00308         );
00309     }
00310 
00311     return (wantarray) ? @output_list : $output_list[0] ;
00312 }
00313 
00314 =head1 "mode"_str_cmp functions
00315 
00316 The functions of the the form "mode"_str_cmp() use different functions to
00317 specify which filters to apply. They take no options except the correct string.
00318 There are also versions which accept a list of strings.
00319 
00320 =over
00321 
00322 =item standard
00323 
00324     std_str_cmp($correctString)
00325     std_str_cmp_list(@correctStringList)
00326 
00327 Filters: compress_whitespace, ignore_case
00328 
00329 =item standard, case sensitive
00330 
00331     std_cs_str_cmp($correctString)
00332     std_cs_str_cmp_list(@correctStringList)
00333 
00334 Filters: compress_whitespace
00335 
00336 =item strict
00337 
00338     strict_str_cmp($correctString)
00339     strict_str_cmp_list(@correctStringList)
00340 
00341 Filters: trim_whitespace
00342 
00343 =item unordered
00344 
00345     unordered_str_cmp( $correctString )
00346     unordered_str_cmp_list( @correctStringList )
00347 
00348 Filters: ignore_order, ignore_case
00349 
00350 =item unordered, case sensitive
00351 
00352     unordered_cs_str_cmp( $correctString )
00353     unordered_cs_str_cmp_list( @correctStringList )
00354 
00355 Filters: ignore_order
00356 
00357 =item ordered
00358 
00359     ordered_str_cmp( $correctString )
00360     ordered_str_cmp_list( @correctStringList )
00361 
00362 Filters: remove_whitespace, ignore_case
00363 
00364 =item ordered, case sensitive
00365 
00366     ordered_cs_str_cmp( $correctString )
00367     ordered_cs_str_cmp_list( @correctStringList )
00368 
00369 Filters: remove_whitespace
00370 
00371 =back
00372 
00373 =head2 Examples
00374 
00375     # Accepts "W. Mozart", "W. MOZarT", and so forth. Case insensitive. All
00376     # internal spaces treated as single spaces.
00377     ANS(std_str_cmp("W. Mozart"));
00378 
00379     # Rejects "mozart". Same as std_str_cmp() but case sensitive.
00380     ANS(std_cs_str_cmp("Mozart"));
00381 
00382     # Accepts only the exact string.
00383     ANS(strict_str_cmp("W. Mozart"));
00384 
00385     # Accepts "a c B", "CBA" and so forth. Unordered, case insensitive, spaces
00386     # ignored.
00387     ANS(unordered_str_cmp("ABC"));
00388 
00389     # Rejects "abc". Same as unordered_str_cmp() but case sensitive.
00390     ANS(unordered_cs_str_cmp("ABC"));
00391 
00392     # Accepts "a b C", "A B C" and so forth. Ordered, case insensitive, spaces
00393     # ignored.
00394     ANS(ordered_str_cmp("ABC"));
00395 
00396     # Rejects "abc", accepts "A BC" and so forth. Same as ordered_str_cmp() but
00397     # case sensitive.
00398     ANS(ordered_cs_str_cmp("ABC"));
00399 
00400 =cut
00401 
00402 sub std_str_cmp {                   # compare strings
00403     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00404     my @filters = ( 'compress_whitespace', 'ignore_case' );
00405     my $type = 'std_str_cmp';
00406     STR_CMP('correct_ans'   =>  $correctAnswer,
00407             'filters'   =>  \@filters,
00408             'type'      =>  $type
00409     );
00410 }
00411 
00412 sub std_str_cmp_list {              # alias for std_str_cmp
00413     my @answerList = @_;
00414     my @output;
00415     while (@answerList) {
00416         push( @output, std_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00417     }
00418     @output;
00419 }
00420 
00421 sub std_cs_str_cmp {                # compare strings case sensitive
00422     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00423     my @filters = ( 'compress_whitespace' );
00424     my $type = 'std_cs_str_cmp';
00425     STR_CMP(    'correct_ans'   =>  $correctAnswer,
00426             'filters'   =>  \@filters,
00427             'type'      =>  $type
00428     );
00429 }
00430 
00431 sub std_cs_str_cmp_list {           # alias for std_cs_str_cmp
00432     my @answerList = @_;
00433     my @output;
00434     while (@answerList) {
00435         push( @output, std_cs_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00436     }
00437     @output;
00438 }
00439 
00440 sub strict_str_cmp {                # strict string compare
00441     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00442     my @filters = ( 'trim_whitespace' );
00443     my $type = 'strict_str_cmp';
00444     STR_CMP(    'correct_ans'   =>  $correctAnswer,
00445             'filters'   =>  \@filters,
00446             'type'      =>  $type
00447     );
00448 }
00449 
00450 sub strict_str_cmp_list {           # alias for strict_str_cmp
00451     my @answerList = @_;
00452     my @output;
00453     while (@answerList) {
00454         push( @output, strict_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00455     }
00456     @output;
00457 }
00458 
00459 sub unordered_str_cmp {             # unordered, case insensitive, spaces ignored
00460     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00461     my @filters = ( 'ignore_order', 'ignore_case' );
00462     my $type = 'unordered_str_cmp';
00463     STR_CMP(    'correct_ans'       =>  $correctAnswer,
00464             'filters'       =>  \@filters,
00465             'type'          =>  $type
00466     );
00467 }
00468 
00469 sub unordered_str_cmp_list {        # alias for unordered_str_cmp
00470     my @answerList = @_;
00471     my @output;
00472     while (@answerList) {
00473         push( @output, unordered_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00474     }
00475     @output;
00476 }
00477 
00478 sub unordered_cs_str_cmp {          # unordered, case sensitive, spaces ignored
00479     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00480     my @filters = ( 'ignore_order' );
00481     my $type = 'unordered_cs_str_cmp';
00482     STR_CMP(    'correct_ans'       =>  $correctAnswer,
00483             'filters'       =>  \@filters,
00484             'type'          =>  $type
00485     );
00486 }
00487 
00488 sub unordered_cs_str_cmp_list {     # alias for unordered_cs_str_cmp
00489     my @answerList = @_;
00490     my @output;
00491     while (@answerList) {
00492         push( @output, unordered_cs_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00493     }
00494     @output;
00495 }
00496 
00497 sub ordered_str_cmp {               # ordered, case insensitive, spaces ignored
00498     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00499     my @filters = ( 'remove_whitespace', 'ignore_case' );
00500     my $type = 'ordered_str_cmp';
00501     STR_CMP(    'correct_ans'   =>  $correctAnswer,
00502             'filters'   =>  \@filters,
00503             'type'      =>  $type
00504     );
00505 }
00506 
00507 sub ordered_str_cmp_list {          # alias for ordered_str_cmp
00508     my @answerList = @_;
00509     my @output;
00510     while (@answerList) {
00511         push( @output, ordered_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00512     }
00513     @output;
00514 }
00515 
00516 sub ordered_cs_str_cmp {            # ordered,  case sensitive, spaces ignored
00517     my $correctAnswer = shift @_;
00518     my @filters = ( 'remove_whitespace' );
00519     my $type = 'ordered_cs_str_cmp';
00520     STR_CMP(    'correct_ans'   =>  $correctAnswer,
00521             'filters'   =>  \@filters,
00522             'type'      =>  $type
00523     );
00524 }
00525 
00526 sub ordered_cs_str_cmp_list {       # alias for ordered_cs_str_cmp
00527     my @answerList = @_;
00528     my @output;
00529     while (@answerList) {
00530         push( @output, ordered_cs_str_cmp(shift @answerList) );
00531     }
00532     @output;
00533 }

00535 
00536 ## LOW-LEVEL ROUTINE -- NOT NORMALLY FOR END USERS -- USE WITH CAUTION
00537 ##
00538 ## IN:  a hashtable with the following entries (error-checking to be added later?):
00539 ##          correctAnswer   --  the correct answer, before filtering
00540 ##          filters         --  reference to an array containing the filters to be applied
00541 ##          type            --  a string containing the type of answer evaluator in use
00542 ## OUT: a reference to an answer evaluator subroutine
00543 sub STR_CMP {
00544     my %str_params = @_;
00545     #my $correctAnswer =  str_filters( $str_params{'correct_ans'}, @{$str_params{'filters'}} );
00546     my $answer_evaluator = new AnswerEvaluator;
00547     $answer_evaluator->{debug} = $str_params{debug};
00548     $answer_evaluator->ans_hash(    
00549         correct_ans       => "$str_params{correct_ans}",
00550         type              => $str_params{type}||'str_cmp',
00551         score             => 0,
00552 
00553     );
00554     # Remove blank prefilter if the correct answer is blank
00555     $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter('erase') if $answer_evaluator->ans_hash->{correct_ans} eq '';
00556 
00557     my %known_filters = (   
00558                 'remove_whitespace'     =>  \&remove_whitespace,
00559                 'compress_whitespace'   =>  \&compress_whitespace,
00560                 'trim_whitespace'       =>  \&trim_whitespace,
00561                 'ignore_case'           =>  \&ignore_case,
00562                 'ignore_order'          =>  \&ignore_order,
00563     );
00564 
00565     foreach my $filter ( @{$str_params{filters}} ) {
00566         #check that filter is known
00567         die "Unknown string filter |$filter|. Known filters are ".
00568              join(" ", keys %known_filters) .
00569              "(try checking the parameters to str_cmp() )"
00570                                 unless exists $known_filters{$filter};
00571         # install related pre_filter
00572         $answer_evaluator->install_pre_filter( $known_filters{$filter} );
00573     }
00574     $answer_evaluator->install_evaluator(sub {
00575             my $rh_ans = shift;
00576             $rh_ans->{_filter_name} = "Evaluator: Compare string answers with eq";
00577             $rh_ans->{score} = ($rh_ans->{student_ans} eq $rh_ans->{correct_ans})?1:0  ;
00578             $rh_ans;
00579     });
00580     $answer_evaluator->install_post_filter(sub {
00581         my $rh_hash = shift; my $c = chr(128); ## something that won't be typed
00582         $rh_hash->{_filter_name} = "clean up preview strings";
00583         $rh_hash->{'preview_text_string'} = $rh_hash->{student_ans};
00584 #       $rh_hash->{'preview_latex_string'} = "\\text{ ".$rh_hash->{student_ans}." }";
00585         $rh_hash->{'preview_latex_string'} = "\\verb".$c.$rh_hash->{student_ans}.$c;
00586         $rh_hash;       
00587     });
00588     return $answer_evaluator;
00589 }
